title: [Large-Scale] Short-Intensive Course for Foreign Language Reading Anxiety Mitigation and Reading Strategy Enhancement for Theology Majors: Mathematical Analysis Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Basic English reading comprehension, understanding of fundamental theological terminology, basic graph/table interpretation skills, and numerical reasoning ability
context.additional_context: Project-Based Learning (PBL) applied to strengthen job relevance in mathematics for in-service professionals. Operated in smartphone-centric limited technological environments, including tasks on statistical data visualization and probabilistic analysis within textual contexts.

learning_goals: Learners will comprehend key concepts and quantitative expressions (e.g., ratios, statistics) in theology-related English texts at over 80% accuracy and summarize key concepts for presentation at least three times
Learners will apply five or more reading strategies (skimming, scanning, graph analysis, data extraction, etc.) contextually to complete text analysis within 20 minutes
Learners will establish a daily 30+ minute English reading habit and submit a log (quantifying reading time/volume/comprehension rate) at least five times over one week

resources: Role card set for group discussion
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
